Topic.Title: Newbie Question about Online Web Editor

Posts.EditableText:
Hi there,

I am absolutely new to Quest (and have yet to actually start to learn how to use it) and would like to ask a question which probably has been asked before:

If I use the Online Web Editor to create a game from my PC at work (on which I would not be allowed to install Quest), can I save the game file created online so that it can also be loaded into Quest that is installed on my PC at home?

Thanks.
Posts.HTML:
Hi there,

I am absolutely new to Quest (and have yet to actually start to learn how to use it) and would like to ask a question which probably has been asked before:

If I use the Online Web Editor to create a game from my PC at work (on which I would not be allowed to install Quest), can I save the game file created online so that it can also be loaded into Quest that is installed on my PC at home?

Thanks.

Posts.EditableText:
Almost - there is a file saved on the server which can be used in the desktop version, but I haven't yet provided a way for you to access it!

If you email me, I can send you your game file so you can continue to work offline.

With the new website it will be much easier for me to add this (much-requested!) feature, so you'll be able to do this automatically soon.
